result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Exhibits 1-4

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State.  Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in court with attorney Quinn T Jolly.  Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in custody.  Defendant states she believes she is competent to proceed.  Hearing to proceed.  Both Dr. Tracy Luchetta and Dr. Deborah Collins sworn and testify.  Exhibits 1 through 4 marked, received.  Court finds that the state has met their burden and finds defendant competent to proceed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in court with attorney Quinn T Jolly.  Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in custody.  Present bond continued on 22CF363.  Evidentiary hearing requested.  Both experts approved to appear via zoom for that hearing but the Court would prefer in person appearances if possible.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Judge - Confidential Record
Competency hearing on May 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

District Attorney David Lasee appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in court with attorney Quinn T Jolly.  Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in custody.  Attorney Heather Richmond also appears.  Attorney Richmond motions to withdraw from the case.  Court grants motion.  Report finds defendant competent to proceed.  Defense attorney requesting an independent evaluation be done. State does not take a position at this time. Court denies independent evaluation at the expense of the County.  Attorney Jolly states they will be asking for funding for an independent evaluation through the State Public Defender but has not been approved at this time.    Present bond continued  Competency hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Extension Letter

AIA previously scheduled for 3/22/22 canceled per Judge Walsh.
Attorneys/DA/VW/BCJ were all notified.

Assistant District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in court with attorney Quinn T Jolly and attorney Heather Richmond.  Defendant Taylor Denise Schabusiness in custody. Court finds probable cause does exist upon review of criminal complaint.  Court grants motion for competency evaluation - orders competency evaluation be completed.  Motion to determine counsel is held open - Attorney Richmond not to have any contact with defendant.  Court will revisit issue after review of the competency report.  Motion to seal motion determining counsel - denied.   Present bond continued  Competency hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
